text: Samuel Autey Cookson (6 September 1868, Chorley, Lancashire, England, UK – 27 February 1947, Bridgwater, Somerset, England, UK), known as S.A. Cookson, was an English stage and film actor. He appeared in the 1899 film King John, adapted by Herbert Beerbohm Tree. ==External links== * Category:1868 births Category:1947 deaths Category:People from Chorley Category:Male actors from Lancashire Category:English male stage actors Category:English male silent film actors Category:20th-century English male actors
title: S. A. Cookson
